title: Keith Ward on Reformulating the Trinity and an Idealist view of God
description:
Dr. Keith Ward is retired professor and philosopher. He is a priest in the Church of England. He is a leading Christian Philosopher supporting an idealist view of reality. He has written many books but we focus our discussion on his book "Christ and the Cosmos: A reformulation of trinitarian doctrine.

We talk about his understanding of the doctrine of the trinity and how this is similar to and different from versions of the trinity based on doctrines of divine simplicity and social doctrines of the trinity. We mention A.J. Ayer, Karl Rahner, Karl Barth, Thomas Aquinas, Plato, Aristotle, Neoplatonism, Richard Swinburne, Beau Branson, and Daniel Dennett. 

You can find Keith Ward's book here: https://www.amazon.com/Christ-Cosmos-Keith-Ward/dp/1107531810

You can find Keith Ward's conversation with Daniel Dennett here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mongL_2KMGg&t=2105s
